meanings.definition: To make or become more ladylike or refined.
meanings.sent1: She decided to ladyfy her outfit by adding a pearl necklace.
meanings.sent2: The etiquette teacher helped the young girls ladyfy their manners.
meanings.sent3: The tomboy tried to ladyfy herself for the fancy party.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress ladyfied her appearance at the event.
meanings.sent5: The floral decorations ladyfied the room for the tea party.

meanings.definition: To treat with the respect and courtesy traditionally given to women.
meanings.sent1: He always makes sure to ladyfy his interactions with his female colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman would ladyfy every lady he met with a polite bow.
meanings.sent3: The knight tried to ladyfy his speech when addressing the queen.
meanings.sent4: The old-fashioned gentleman ladyfied his behavior towards women.
meanings.sent5: The chivalrous act of holding the door ladyfied his gesture towards her.
